page.title: 09Home Life - Hittisleigh
page.content: There are no shops in this area, the nearest being at Cheriton Bishop, but there are a surprising number of free deliveries including daily milk and post, except Sundays, bread twice a week, meat, a travelling grocers shop, coal, bottled gas, paraffin and a mobile library. There is also a weekly bus service to Crediton. Most properties have a large garden up to several acres and use the land in a variety of ways; to supplement their income, pursue a hobby and to produce some of their own food, from animals; house-cows, goats, ducks, chicken and bees, and by growing their own fruit and vegetables. Much is preserved in deep-freezers while several people make cheese, cream, wine, jam and pickles. Pets kept include cats, dogs, horses, ponies, peacocks, ferrets and a parrot.
